place.name: DUNTISBOURNE ROUSE
place.gazetteerText: DUNTISBORNE-ROUSE, a parish in Cirencester district, Gloucester; adjacent to Ermine-street, 4 miles NNW of Cirencester town and r. station. Post town, Daglingworth, under Cirencester. Acres, 1, 730. Real property, £1, 889. Pop., 127. Houses, 30. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Gloucester and Bristol. Value, £243.* Patron, Christ church college, Oxford. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
